alert.note: Alert for Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:56PM CDT until August 27 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Wolf River Above Gulfport affecting Harrison County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tchoutacabouffa River Above D`Iberville affecting Harrison County. Biloxi River Near Lyman affecting Harrison County. For the Wolf River...including Landon, Gulfport...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Biloxi River...including Wortham, Lyman...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Tchoutacabouffa River...including D`Iberville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Biloxi River Near Lyman. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Major flooding will occur in Retreat and Riverland Village Subdivisions at the 16 foot stage. Homes on lower Fisherman Trail will remain flooded and lower River Road will be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.5 feet on 04/01/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
